\section{Natural Transformations}

\subsection{Definition}
A natural transformation $\alpha : F \Rightarrow G$ from a functor $F:C \to D$
to a functor $G: C \to D$ consists of: \parencite{fong:7sketches}

\begin{itemize}
  \item $c$-Components\\
    $(\alpha_c : F(c) \to G(c)) \in D,\ (\forall c\in \mathrm{ob}_C)$\\
    If every $c$-component is an isomorphism the natural transformation is then
    called a natural isomorphism.
  \item Naturality Condition\\
    The following diagram commutes\footnote{Parallel morphisms i.e. those with
    the same source and target, are equal}
    % https://q.uiver.app/?q=WzAsNCxbMCwwLCJGKGMpIl0sWzEsMCwiRihkKSJdLFswLDEsIkcoYykiXSxbMSwxLCJHKGQpIl0sWzAsMiwiXFxhbHBoYV9jIl0sWzEsMywiXFxhbHBoYV9kIl0sWzAsMSwiRihmKSJdLFsyLDMsIkcoZikiLDJdXQ==
    \[\begin{tikzcd}
      {F(c)} & {F(d)} \\
      {G(c)} & {G(d)}
      \arrow["{\alpha_c}", from=1-1, to=2-1]
      \arrow["{\alpha_d}", from=1-2, to=2-2]
      \arrow["{F(f)}", from=1-1, to=1-2]
      \arrow["{G(f)}"', from=2-1, to=2-2]
    \end{tikzcd}\]
    e.g.
    % https://q.uiver.app/?
    \[\begin{tikzcd}
      & C & D \\
      a & b & 1 & {F(a)} & {F(b)} & 6 \\
      &&& {G(a)} & {G(b)}
      \arrow["g", from=2-3, to=2-4]
      \arrow["h"', from=2-3, to=3-4]
      \arrow["{\alpha_a}", from=2-4, to=3-4]
      \arrow["{\alpha_b}"', from=2-5, to=3-5]
      \arrow["{F(f)}", from=2-4, to=2-5]
      \arrow["{G(f)}"', from=3-4, to=3-5]
      \arrow["i", from=2-5, to=2-6]
      \arrow["j"', from=3-5, to=2-6]
      \arrow["f", from=2-1, to=2-2]
      \arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,92;green,92;blue,214}, curve={height=-18pt}, dotted, from=2-1, to=2-4]
      \arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,92;green,92;blue,214}, curve={height=-18pt}, dotted, from=2-2, to=2-5]
      \arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,214;green,92;blue,92}, dotted, from=2-1, to=3-4]
      \arrow[draw={rgb,255:red,214;green,92;blue,92}, dotted, from=2-2, to=3-5]
      \arrow["F"{description}, draw={rgb,255:red,92;green,92;blue,214}, curve={height=-18pt}, from=1-2, to=1-3]
      \arrow["G"{description}, draw={rgb,255:red,214;green,92;blue,92}, curve={height=18pt}, from=1-2, to=1-3]
    \end{tikzcd}\]
\end{itemize}
